Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Then setting autoprice with one of the default scripts to get going
```
$ cat dgb_auto_kmd 
#!/bin/bash
source userpass
curl -s --url "http://127.0.0.1:7783" --data "{\"minprice\":0.02,\"maxprice\":0.4,\"userpass\":\"$userpass\",\"method\":\"autoprice\",\"base\":\"DGB\",\"rel\":\"KMD\",\"margin\":0.05,\"refbase\":\"digibyte\",\"refrel\":\"coinmarketcap\"}"


$ ./dgb_auto_kmd | jq '.'
{
  "result": "success"
}
```

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You cant import privkey like that

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Restart DGB with -rescan without closing the marketmaker

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: marketmaker will only do `importaddress` I am 99% sure, and will only check UTXO's ont he watch only address

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I have seen this behaviour a heap fo times. Either send the balance yourself or rescan the blockchain.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @Mylo

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If you do the balance -> self option, make sure you keep marketmaker open, and it will "see" the utxos

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
If you try a withdraw it will show something like "selected 0 fof 3 utxo" 
But fter you send the balance with the deamon, it will be able to select the UTXO.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: ok thx mate, this is on bob side.  i'll rescan and and go feed myself!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: rescan OR send balance

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: either will work

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this will be on any side in native

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
```importaddress.(DGB DMqzVS4bJyRjuL3abinPVMGPsMvjakigw6) -> ({"result":null,"error":{"code":-4,"message":"The wallet already contains the private key for this address or script"},"id":"jl777"}
``` good to know.  maybe sending balance to self with a 15s block time DGB has would have been quicker.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If you send balance while marketmaker is running, its 99% of the time perfectly fine in seeing the utxos

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if they are already in the "wallet" it cant find them

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: hmmmm...ok v.handy

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no worries, its by design, if it didnt work like that it would ahve to rescan the whole blockchian on marketmakre load, that would suck lol.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: yep makes sense.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: good one for the rule book üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: easiest work around is to not have the privkey in the wallet, then send after marketmaker is alreay running

Content: from another address

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I believe getprices api is this just an aggregate of P2P broadcasting prices that bdex collects, is that right? This might vary significant from CMC correct?  I‚Äôm trying to price my trades in btc, pairs that aren‚Äôt directly priced in btc like ltc/kmd. I‚Äôm leaning toward estimating the btc value of each using an external source like an exchange rather than bdex getprices. Does that seem like an ideal choice?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getprices is what your node has seen most recently, no assurance it is anything like CMC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: cipi has a setup where he gets prices from external sources

Author: tolken#2655
Content: The slight concern is that for a 20min atomic swap (or longer) the price may drift more than I‚Äôd like, so I may have to grab the price from cex right at the start of an attempted trade.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, best to do it as soon as you see alicepayment

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I‚Äôm pulling prices from external sources as well, bittrex and binance presently

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then you know it is a matter of confirms before the trade completes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so a perfect time to issue the balancing trade to binance

Author: tolken#2655
Content: good call, I‚Äôll do that. That has been my trigger for everything,

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in the even the price moves more than 12.5%, you can just not send the bobpayment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it isnt much consolation, but having a 12.5% worst case is better than a 12.6% worst case

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I figure this slippage will average out most of the time, so not too worried about it, but that‚Äôs an interesting idea.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: Adjusting pricing based on volatility might not be a bad idea either.

Author: tolken#2655
Content: I learned how to query native chains locally to confirm bob/Alice payments. That‚Äôs handy.

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
not sure if that is what you mean. But you can trade on BarterDEX and inverse the trades on a CEX interacting with their API.
lets say:
you Sell on BarterDEX 10KMD for 0.1 LTC
on a CEX at the same time you Buy 0.1 LTC for 9 KMD
1KMD is your profit

Author: KomodoWorld#8282

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi, I've seen `trex (and  cryptopia) error getting marketsummaries` errors when my connection on autoprice drops.
I'm wondering if I can use those markets in my autoprice scrip instead of `CMC`.  Does anyone do this if it can be done?
(eg. `"refrel\":\"coinmarketcap\"` replaced with `"refrel\":\"trex\"`) ?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: `curl --url "http://127.0.0.1:7783" --data "{\"userpass\":\"$userpass\",\"method\":\"autoprice\",\"base\":\"KMD\",\"rel\":\"BTC\",\"margin\":0.03}"` is doing exactly that... it tries Bittrex and then Cryptopia

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thanks, @cipi !  So `"refrel\":\"coinmarketcap\"` isn't needed?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: no, only if you want to use cmc

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: If I wanted to use prices from just one exchange (eg. Bittrex) and not use cryptopia etc, could I use ```"refrel\":\"trex\"```?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: no, afaik mm tries Bittrex and if the coin is not listed there, it uses Cryptopia

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Cool. Thanks for your help!

Content:
Hey guys,
I am rewriting the dicoapp with React, Redux and Webpack. You can view the source here: https://github.com/particle4dev/dicoapp-e. 
The application need to displayed transactions when it start. I realized that it was quite slow and make poor user experience.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: DB/SWAPS folder has all the pending swaps

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you do need to do some app side caching

Author: namhoang28#4328
Content: @jl777c uhm, thank you!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont call swapstatus without requestid/quoteid, as that will take quite a long time

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one way is to use recentswaps to get list of recent swaps

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and swapstatus(requestid,quoteid) for those swaps that are still in progress

Author: luke#8628
Content: Hello! I am reading through the BarterDex api docs (https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/KomodoPlatform/wiki/barterDEX-API-Summary-by-Category#buy) and under the "buy" method it says that "If a match is not found, a bid order will be added in the orderbook". However, when I issue a buy order that doesn't have a match, nothing is added to the orderbook. I can see the buy order being broadcast to the network, and then it times out with a "time expired for Alice_request". Whereas if I run "setprice" instead, I can immediately see the ask/bid in the orderbook. Is this misdocumented, or am I missing something? maybe I need to add some parameter to the buy order to get it added to the orderbook and stay there for a certain duration?

Author: tolken#2655
Content: @luke  I could be mistaken, but that sounds like an error in the documentation to me. Afaik, if you buy and nothing happens, the Alice request expires. The GTC flag will cause BarterDex to repeatedly try and ‚Äúbuy‚Äù periodically until you stop it. To set a price, I believe you‚Äôre making a Bob configuration where your request is broadcast to the orderbooks then passively awaits Alice requests.

Author: luke#8628
Content: @tolken  yes, that lines up with what I have experienced as well. thanks! I'm not familiar with the GTC flag. Is the GTC flag a UI flag in the BarterDex app, or is that a flag that can be set in the RPC data directly?

Author: cipi#4502
Content: GTC is in the GUI... best way to do orderbook-entries is `autoprice` though
